Hi <@U059AC59LLF>
I hope you had a relaxing weekend. :relaxed:

I’ve been deep-diving into the best path forward for the website launch, especially given the recent scope changes. Wanted to share some insights and thoughts before our meeting on Tuesday.

*Quick Update*: The SM free pages are looking good for completion this week. But, with the extended scope and additional features for the Pro version and Julien's design updates, I've been looking into the best approach for our launch plan.

We’re looking at a couple of strategies to ensure we’re aligning with both our quality standards and your expectations. Here are the options we came up with:

1. *Full Launch in April*: This option would allow us to include all flows, pages, and design updates in the launch, ensuring a comprehensive presentation of both the free and Pro versions. In this approach we will hand over, both SM free and pro by the end of March, on staging for your review. Then we will have 10 to 14 days to implement any possible feedback from your side and also prepare for launch early/mid-April.
2. *Two-Phased Launch*: In this approach, we will divide the scope into 2 phases:
    ◦ *First Phase in Mid-March*: We go live with the new branding for the free version (I’m referring to the logo, color and font changes) and introduce a redesigned homepage hero section. This phase would exclude the user with an expired subscription flows, Onboarding guide, and Deals pages, and the majority of the new design changes Julien proposed.
    ◦ *Second Phase*: Following the initial launch, we would focus on updating the remainder of the free pages based on the new proposed design and completing the tasks excluded in the first phase. This approach ensures that we can still meet an earlier timeline for part of the project, while providing additional time to perfect the remaining elements by mid-April.
Please review the options so we can discuss them in detail on Tuesday to land on what works best for you and the project's success.
Your thoughts before our call would be very helpful, or if there's anything specific you want to dive into, just let me know.

Some things that are not vital at launch for us:
• Anything Tactics related
• Accent and colors for other pages except the homepage

Thank you Manu. :blush: 
Yes we will start the launching process on Sunday 6:30am Vienna time.

Hi <@U039WK9NWA0>, thanks. Hope you’re having a good start to the week! Would it help to add more hours in March? So adjusting our contract to 125 hours in March or so perhaps?

Generally, we’d like to do a full launch all at once for several reasons.

And we’d prefer it sooner rather than later.

We also want to make sure we have enough time for possible debugging and slight adjustments for the live website if there are obvious and relatively straight forward improvements to make. That’s why we added additionally 15-20 hours compared to the estimated needed for the March rollout initially.

Also, in terms of design changes, what’s the rough status there? What elements or pages still need to be adjusted to the Enhanced version? I’m asking because many of the smaller elements I think could be tweaked after launch, especially things like accent colors and elements, as long as the color scheme, navigation, and enhanced home page are all done. So other pages, just with adjusted color scheme and new navbar might be enough to go live.

It’s a tricky balance here where we don’t want to go live with an incomplete website but we also don’t expect it to be perfect, that’s why we did the 100 + 40 + 40 + 40 for the next months :smile: We think we will make smaller, less vital adjustments in this period.

Hi <@U059AC59LLF>
Quick update here.

We've implemented the recent anti-spam updates on the production site.
• *Cloudflare Turnstile* is now active on all Gravity Forms (using the _managed challenge_ mode to avoid interrupting real users).
• *Rate-Limiting Plugin* has been updated with a *regex-based email blocklist*.
    ◦ → Currently, it blocks emails that start with a letter followed by more than 7 digits — the common pattern among recent spam submissions.
• *Cloudflare Managed Challenge Rule* has been applied for the *suspicious IP ranges and user agents* identified from recent spam entries.
We monitored turnstile analytics and the Cloudflare security rule in the past few days, and everything seems okay.

Hi <@U039WK9NWA0>, we’re running into another spam issue. Emails like <mailto:u5486365758@gmail.com|u5486365758@gmail.com> show up again and again after I deleted them manually and they don’t get blocked by the rate limiting feature or current Cloudflare rules. Could you help us out with this? Fine if it delays other tasks for this quarter, more important to solve the spam

Hi Manu,
we're implementing the rate limit plugin in production and wanted to clarify its potential impact on form submissions. Over the past two days, as we tested all forms, we temporarily disabled it to prevent reaching submission limitations.
Currently, it's active on all main forms, including SM, PoM, Tactics, and the Pro landing page forms. The rate limit is set to block a user after three attempts, meaning if a user submits a form three times, they won't be able to submit a fourth for the next seven days.
We want to ensure you understand how this functionality could affect form submissions and welcome any suggestions you might have to tailor it to your needs. There's a tradeoff between increasing the number of attempts allowed and potentially inviting spam submissions. Additionally, it's important to note that we have Google reCAPTCHA enabled on all forms for added security.

The user submits their email on the Landing Page, it gets added to SM Pro.

Once the user finishes the signup on the checkout page, they get the Forum Username assigned in Campaign Monitor and Paying Sub field also updates to Active. This allows us to then segment active subscribers separately, within the same list.

And it lets us do abandoned checkout emails for those who have their emails there but no Paying Sub.

We can also then update Paying Sub to Canceled when someone stops their subscription, so we can try to win them back at a later time.

So, we add them on the same list for their intent to try Stacked Marketer Pro, then use custom fields to define their actual subscription status.

hey <@U059AC59LLF> quick question

Our dev team questions the "Content Type" & "*Business Model*" & "*Topic*" selectors on the Full Archive page, since the options under all are actually subcategories of the 'Pro' category. Their concern is

"Using one taxonomy for three selectors creates complexity. Imagine that the client creates a new category. How can we decide which selectors should show it?"

Now, there are two options in my head as a solution to this question:
1. Leave it as it is, if you add another subcategory in the future as a Content Type, Business Model or Topic, then there's a maintenance need to put that under the related dropdown within Archive page.
2. Let's create a new taxonomy structure where Pro category has 3 sub categories within which the related tags are organized. (This approach might need a migration but will futureproof tag structure and Archive dropdowns)
    a. Content Type 
        i. Report
        ii. Article
    b. Business Model
        i. E-commerce
        ii. SaaS...
    c. Topic
        i. Copywriting
        ii. Paid Social...

hey <@U059AC59LLF>  can you please comment the following question below?

While we have the data of course progress in CM, we can create segments according to these criteria:
• Collect users who have not enrolled in any course/courses.
• Collect users who have enrolled in course/courses but have not made any progress (0% progress).
• Collect users who have completed course/courses (100% progress).
In other words, the segments we create can filter based on non-enrollment, started courses (0% progress), completed courses (100% progress), *but we cannot filter based on progress value (for example, filtering users who have less than 50% progress in a course).*

If these three segmentations align with the client's needs, we can continue with the current development approach, which benefits us by storing all course progress in just one single field. Additionally, it will not be necessary to manually add a couple of new custom keys per course.

Hey <@U059AC59LLF>

The team let me know they had to temporarily disable Perfmatters to fix <https://refactco.slack.com/archives/C0594LCK43H/p1748813691233639?thread_ts=1745238486.006899&cid=C0594LCK43H|the issue> with Gravity Forms redirects.

The problem is that Perfmatters tries to optimize JavaScript, but the way it’s currently set up conflicts with how Gravity Forms handles redirects. Disabling it was the quickest way to get things working again. We do recommend turning it back on once the conflict is sorted out, since it helps with site performance.

There are two ways we can move forward:
1. *Tweak Perfmatters settings*: Instead of delaying all JavaScript, we can be more selective about which files to delay. It’s a more reliable long-term fix, but would take around 4–6 hours of dev and testing to make sure everything works smoothly.
2. *Stick with the current setup*: We keep delaying all JS and try to find the specific file(s) causing the issue to exclude them. It’s faster, but there’s a higher chance of running into similar problems later.
Since we're currently out of retainer hours, I wanted to check in and see if resolving this is something you’d like to prioritize this quarter.

<@U059AC59LLF> regarding the User Guide we proposed as part of the onboarding flow, our team has made research about tools for this task.

*None-Free solutions:*
In general, None-Free solutions offers some features that are not available in free ones, but those features may not be necessary for every product.

The main two advantages that they offer are:
• giving analytics for tracking the interaction of users during the tour (i.e which steps skipped, which dialog boxes ended the guide ,...)
• segmentation and creating different tours per user groups (this is also feasible via free tools but need some development time)
These none-free tools in their first tier have limitations of around 2,500 users per month. For the first tier they have different prices from $30 to $250 per month.
in the case that client wants to choose amongst theses non-free tools then we can give them a more detailed comparison.

*Free solutions:*
we have 3 options in this category:
1. *Simple Tour Guide WordPress plugin*: this is a useful tool for someone who wants to creates tours without any need to customization in dialog position, dialog events and etc.
2. *a11y-dialog*: as it describes it self, it is just a dialog window which follows w3 consortium’s modal pattern. it does not have any special features/methods which been developed for user onboarding
3. *introjs*: Due to its feature set, handy API, and rich documentation, Intro.js offers a wide range of customization options for creating guided tours, allowing developers to precisely handle the user experience. Its features include step-by-step guidance, highlighting specific elements, and easy integration into web pages. It maintains a good balance between being feature-rich while remaining relatively easy to implement. It’s also worth mentioning that using Intro.js for commercial purposes requires a license, with its lifetime license costing $10.
Our suggestion is using *<https://introjs.com/|introjs> ,* but we wanted your approval before moving fwd.

Note: UserGuide flow  design will be created after SM Pro Homepage is finished.

Hey <@U059AC59LLF> another question on Coversion Deeplink

When a visitor clicks a CTA on an external website and lands on StackedMarketer, we store the 'offered_content' data using a cookie. This allows us to retain information about the offered content even if the visitor doesn't make a purchase during their initial visit. In subsequent visits to StackedMarketer, we can still identify the specific offered content for which they are considering a subscription.

Dev Question is:
• Currently, in the initial code, I have set the expiration time for the cookie to be 1 day.
What would be the appropriate expiration time for the cookie in terms of hours or days?

My answer was:
• I believe this should not expire unless: the user comes back to subscription via a pro content PAYWALL. 
    ◦ If the user comes to payment to unlock a content (ie, paywall), then we should update the 'offered_content' as the paywalled content. 
    ◦ If not, it should remain as it is and not expire.
Can you confirm my solution, or propose another one appropriate for your customers?

1. Image on Campaign Monitor:

    ◦ URL: <https://i4.createsend1.com/ei/j/61/D7A/FCB/193625/csimport/test-2_3.png>
2. Image on WordPress:
    ◦ Name: test-2.png
    ◦ URL: <https://www.stackedmarketer.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/test-2.png>
To fix this issue and ensure that the correct images are displayed on Campaign Monitor, we will implement a solution that generates a unique name for every single image. This will prevent naming conflicts and ensure that the intended images are always displayed.

Hey <@U059AC59LLF>
Our friends have spotted an issue: Currently users can edit their e-mail adress on the <https://www.stackedmarketer.com/account/|Profile Page>.
However we think that e-mail should not be something that can be changed right away, due to the following reasons
• E-mail is the unique identifier of an account from business perspective
• Changing e-mail can cause potential issues in terms of consistency and functionality. An example is :
    ◦ When a user changes e-mail, the mail preference token created by Memberpress stays the same which causes problems on e-mails. 
RESULT: We suggest to make the e-mail field of the profile page NON EDITABLE. If an edge case happens where a user really needs to change their e-mail, they should just get in touch with support.

Hi Emanuel,

Thank you for reaching out.

To extend the trial period for an individual member, you can use the steps in our documentation here: Manually Extending User Access to Protected Content under the Manually Extending Automatically Recurring Subscriptions → Keeping Billings Intact section.

But since the transaction for the trial period is a hidden transaction (if the trial is free), you’ll need to add &include-confirmations=true to the end of the URL after step 3 of the Editing the most recent transaction section. So, the full URL would look like this: <https://yourdomain.com/wp-admin/admin.php?page=memberpress-trans&subscription=123&include-confirmations=true>. This will display the hidden transaction, so it can be edited.

I hope this helps.
Kind regards,
